title: Work Bus
description: When Jim convinces Dwight that the building is unsafe, Dwight rents a bus and sets up the office inside. Nellie asks for Andy's help in adopting a baby. Meanwhile, Jim tries to make Pam happy with some pie.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright everybody, great season of softball, I'm super proud of you guys and I think you're gonna like this little highlight reel that I put together. [Andy plays video]

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andy Bernard presents: Summer Softball Epic Fails! [Kevin swings bat on screen, fart noise follows] Fail. [repeats] Fail.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's me. [repeats]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fail.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Is this like a blooper reel?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A blooper reel? What is this, 2005? I look like Bob Saget? Fail! [Points to video] Who's this guy? [Jim steps back and forth from plate on video as Andy sings Meow Mix theme]Look at him dance.  Fail!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fail!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I deserved that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Darryl runs in slow motion on video] Do do do do do do do.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That was a triple.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can't take the fail? Get out of the fail video!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: My pleasure.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Clark and Pete are shown on screen]

quotes.speaker: Video Andy
quotes.text: Hey, I'm Pete, puberty is such a drag, man. And I'm Clark! I like to eat toilet paper. [Clark and Pete wave at camera] We fail! [Video shows memorial of Jerry]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'd like to take a solemn moment to remember Jerry in the warehouse who passed away this year. [Screen flashes 'FAIL' over Jerry's face, accompanied by fart noise, repeats twice.] Well, that's all folks. [photo of Andy watersking shows on screen] Ski ya later everybody.  Thanks for a great season. [Group claps halfheartedly]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What was that? That was just a normal video with you making vulgar noises.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I worked with what I had, Oscar. Next time do more failure stuff, OK?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, what happened to that video I sent you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh that wasn't...that didn't work. That was not the right..[Group protests]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I got it right here. [Cheering on screen, Andy struggles with lifting water cooler, then falls over dumping the fluids on himself][Group laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That was not a fail.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Fail! Fail! Fail!...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Group continues chanting "Fail!"]That was actually a serious accident that could have resulted in severe bodily harm. [Group keeps chanting] You're all failing right now. [Group continues] Congratulations on your epic fail of the use of the word fail! [Group claps and chants]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Toby uses tester on wall as Erin marks wall with red tape X] Oh, god.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nothing! Nothing is going on.  Keep moving please.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What's he measuring?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, excuse me. I am the landlord. This is between me and the management, no one else. Please.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's an EMF hotspot.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [Gasps] Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It stands for electromagnetic field.  Generally cause by a concentration of wiring in one area [Erin marks red tape X on the floor] Especially if they're poorly insulated. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, OK I'm just walking into this. Am I to understand there is a bee hive in the wall?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You think I have a machine for measuring bee hives?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was just asking a question, Toby. How are you not murdered every hour?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Well I'm not getting paid to work in a microwave oven.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, listen. Everything here is up to code.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [mocking] Oh, the wires need insulation. [normal voice] It's a wire people. I'm not buying it a fur coat.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Jim rushes to open door for her] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You got it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Last week, I finally told Pam about the other job I took in Philly...the side job. And she was so incredibly cool about it. And now I just wanna do something huge for her. Like if we were in some biker bar and she mouthed off to some bikers and they came lumbering over and I was like wham! [mimes punch] Gotta go through me first.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Andy, could I have a word please? Um, it won't take a moment. It's extremely important and it really has to happen now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine. I will give you one minute.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, please don't use the hourglass.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You have one minute and your minute has begun and no time will be added at the end, even to accommodate this sentence with all of it's baroque dependent clauses and cascading turns of phrase.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I'm trying to adopt a baby.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A baby what? A human?!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: And the...agency require a character reference from my employer.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You wouldn't have to do anything. I would write the letter myself and you just simply sign it. So.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, OK. And fall right into your plagiarism entrapment scheme? I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: It's not..it's-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And I happen to notice you're down to about thirty seconds here.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well then if I could just convince...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And those sand grains are tumbling..

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: With fury...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: It's not..it's not

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Down the sides..

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Entrapment if I'm..

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of the hourglass..

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: ..writing..

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Time's up!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure.  I'll read her letter. And if she tells the truth about how evil and unfit to be a mother she is, then yeah. I'll sign that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Reading from computer] "Statistical correlations exist between EMF radiation and various health hazards. But mainstream studies are inconclusive!" That means you can't make me do squat.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You better fix this. I already ditched my uterus and I ain't losing any more good parts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You people don't realize what you're asking. I'd have to rip open the walls.  We'd have to shut this place down for a week.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Week off. That'd be great.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Jim puts popcorn bag in microwave] Hey, if you don't want to teach me Power Point, just say so.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I don't want to teach you Power Point.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come on! Just show me the Power Point.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Just do the tutorial.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You're the tutorial.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: No, dude, I'm not. I'm not the tutorial.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You could be.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Mm-mm.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [to Jim] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Getting my wife a week off from work.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You popped one kernel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Awesome, right? [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So Creed is that dude's step dad?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Correct.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I don't know about the rest of you but I'm just gonna say it. I'm nervous. I have no idea what health problems this is all gonna cause. [group agrees, protests]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Come on.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I'm getting older. I'm losing my hair...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'm not gonna grow a third arm!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know what Jim is trying to do. He's trying to get big bad Dwight to shell out for a huge repair job while lucky Jimbo gets a paid vacation. Well sorry, lucky Jimbo, I can live very happily in a magnetic field. Most of my childhood heroes got their power that way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [reading from computer] "Side effects of EMF include: headaches..."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Had 'em all my life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "..breast pain..."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No nobbies, no probbies. Nice try Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oof. "Infertility."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Yeah right. [Dwight moves mouse pad over his crotch]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah! There's my popcorn. Can you just grab that for me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Psh. Keep your snacks on your side, Jim. Idiot. [notices popped kernels in the bag] What the?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Some of these kernels have crowned.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's impossible, cause that's a brand new bag...[looks up to ceiling where there is a red tape X over Dwight's chair] Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy! [Jim mimes basketball shot]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna drive you up to the lake, give you a whole week on the water. Just you, me and the kids.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, can we stop by that pie stand on the way?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You mean Laverne's Pies Tires Fixed Also? [Pam nods] Yes we will be doing that. We'll be getting a dozen.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A dozen different pies? Cause that means rhubarb.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why would you say that? I meant 4 apple, 4 blueberry, 2 cherry, 1 peach and 1 chocolate. I thought that was implied.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, OK then.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I have heard your complaints and we reached a settlement.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, we will be leaving the office for one whole week.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Nice job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In my contract, it is stipulated that I provide a temporary work space. It will arrive in one hour.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Bus pulls into lot] Bring it in!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Roll into the future with Work Bus. Say goodbye to wasteful buildings. These days a mobile office isn't just for hotshot politicians. Now anyone can rent a work bus. [Meredith and Kevin bump chairs in bus angrily] If you've got a parking lot, a work space is just a phone call away. [Erin tapes candy dish to pole] In this age of belt tightening and less empowered workers, a work bus is how tomorrow gets things done.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on phone] There are a hundred packs..

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [On phone] No six after the eight, no....

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Shh!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Shh!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Ninety nine cases..yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Six. [Pete opens air vent over Angela, papers go flying]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ooh!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh sorry! Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [bumps into Meredith] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Lose weight.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm trying. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [handing Nelly envelope] Oh, the Pennsylvania Department of Public Welfare Pre-Adoption Standard.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh of course, you were adopted.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [laughs] I wish! No, I um, I made some short lists. I had a couple sleepovers, but I never managed to get in the end zone. I don't know what it was. Not loveable maybe? [laughs] Oh well.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Listen, I'm really struggling with this form. But as you know the system, you think maybe you could..?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Absolutely.  I know exactly what they want to hear. I would love to help.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh thank you so much!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [whispers] Just don't tell Andy, because..

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: He hates me and thinks I'm a monster. Should go back to Loch Ness. [Erin nods]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Stretch. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How many times do you need to take a stroll?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I, my legs cramp up! Ok, it's a circulation issue.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Boy, I will hammer spank your rear.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, alright, gang. Let's just settle down. You're yelling in her face.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: It's a medical thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just...you good?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I'm good. I..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] I'm so sorry for all of this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's OK. You know what they say, a change is as good as a rest.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I, I need to get to the paper please. [Reaching for overhead bin above Pam, papers fall and Pam has liquid spilled on her]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god! Ah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll get you a napkin. Someone get napkins please!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what? It's fine, it's fine. Let me just...it's fine. [Pam leaves work bus]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, I'm really sorry. I- I'm really sorry about...all that. [Dwight smiles at Jim] Really? Smirking?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What can I say? I love justice. You forced me to spend money on needless repairs, and uh now you're locked in a prison bus and your woman drips with beverage.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. I was trying to do something nice for Pam.  Can you just, help me out? Can we maybe take this thing somewhere? Or do something to not make this the worst day ever?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not my responsibility to solve your marriage problems by spending my money on gas.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yo. Dudeces.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're the boss. Don't you think we'd all be a lot more productive if while we were doing work we looked up and saw the best rural pie stand in Pennsylvania?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I know I'd be more productive.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: As would I.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No question.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. No! This is a work bus. The wheels are for transporting the work space to and from the work site.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you talking about? You're not the boss. Andy is. Andy?

quotes.speaker: {Phyllis}, {Kevin} & {Stanley}
quotes.text: Pies! Pies! Pies! Pies! Pies!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright! The fat people have spoken! Dwight, get this bus moving.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes! [Group cheers]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Next stop: Laverne's Pies Tires Fixed Also.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! Yes! [Group cheers, Dwight moves to driver seat]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [To Dwight] So it looks like this work bus was a pretty good idea after all, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get your foot behind the yellow line.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You got it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah Jim! [Group claps]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Sitting outside building] Stop.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Come back.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Too late.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Shabooyah, role call. Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah, role call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My name is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I like to paint.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You think you're better?

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh no you ain't!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Role Call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah role call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah, role call!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My name is Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That is my name.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They call me Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cause that's my name.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Role call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah role call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah role call!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [Dwight pulls over to pick up hitchhiker] Thanks. Playing a little hookey from work today....Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin road trip twenty twelve! [group takes pictures] Ah OK, now a serious one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, where's Dwight? He should be a part of this. Has he been acting kinda weird to you lately?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If by lately you mean the last twelve years, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I mean he's sulking. That's not like him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's just mad that we're all having fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Then why isn't he scheming? Or preparing to avenge?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's fine. He's indestructible.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Always say that a child is placed for adoption, never surrendered. We're not hostages.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [laughs] Well, I have considered kidnapping one.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Never say that.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I am so excited thinking about this child you're going to adopt.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I wish I could just wave a magic wand and make you a parentless five year old again. I would snap you up.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Next stop pies! [group joins in]

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Next stop pies!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Next stop pies!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's go driver! [clapping] Laverne packs up the pie wagon at five so...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: At five? That's only twenty minutes from now. The pie shop is thirteen miles away. So at fifty five miles an hour that just gives us five minutes to spare.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So wait, when pies are involved you can suddenly do math in your head?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wh...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hold on, Kevin, how much is 19,154 pies divided by 61 pies?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: 314 pies.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What if it were salads?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, it's the...carry the four...and...it doesn't work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry to spoil Jim's fantastic voyage everyone, but we're almost out of gas.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, well I saw a station about a mile back so, chop chop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That name brand place? Nope forget about it, sorry. The tanks are so big on this thing, five cents a gallon extra, that really adds up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you kidding me? Dwight, come on!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey honey, I don't think we should push him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, I'm gonna push him. You know why? Because you're getting a pie. Why? Cause you deserve it. And what is he doing? He's trying to drive us all around the countryside looking for gas because he knows we won't get there. Is that what we want?!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop ordering me around, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do we want?!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Pies!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When do we want it?!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Pies!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, fine. You win.  Jim, you win. We have been battling for a long time, but you know what? You win, cause you are the winner, you are the alpha male, there you go. [drops keys in Jim's lap] Alpha male, go buy your wife a pie. Go buy the whole world a pie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's impossible. [Dwight climbs through ceiling hatch] Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh my!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Dwight, what the hell?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well now I don't even feel like pie. Wait...no it's back.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [Dwight's footsteps sound from the ceiling] Just drive away. Just..

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phyllis! That's not safe.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Guys, we only have eighteen minutes left.  At sixty one miles an hour we're just gonna barely make it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Go up and check on him. He's upset.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know he's doing all this on purpose.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Please? Just make sure he's OK? [Jim climbs through hatch]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hurry it up for god's sake. They're gonna be out of banana cream!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Banana cream is the first to go.  We'll be lucky to get pumpkin at this point! [group gasps]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight? Why are you such a jerk? I am trying to do something for my wife and you keep derailing-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm barren, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My trouser hives are void of honey.  I had congress with Angela and the child that she bore did not issue from my loins. I thought I would be a father and instead I am a eunuch. Neutered by my own building.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is this about the popcorn? Or the X on the ceiling? Dwight, that was a prank.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You mean you flooded my building with dangerous electromagnetic radiation as a prank?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's genius. That's the best prank you've ever done. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll take it.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Um, is this a good time?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Perfect time. I'm right in the middle of a rooftop crisis. [takes paper from Nelly] Fine, let me read it. What do we have here? Uh, ok, [reading] blah blah blah blah blah, dah dah dah dah dah dah, you've made this very easy for me. It's unsignable.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, why, is there something?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's inaccurate, dishonest and...in a word? Dongwater.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ah well, perhaps I could rewrite some of the-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Here's the thing, you asked me to do you a favor? I did it. I read it. Thank you very much to me for my time.  Good luck with your impossible dream.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Alright then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, sometimes it takes couples years to get pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really? How long did it take you and Pam to conceive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What position did you use to conceive?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok...that's not...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Regular? Or lady on her back? You used lady on her back, didn't you, you freak. Yuck, gross. Never mind, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [To Pete. Crying sounds come from behind Nelly's curtain] British women. Famously overemotional. Am I right?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: I don't think that's Nelly.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, oh no, no. Look, it's alright. [Erin cries, Nelly comforts her] It really isn't your fault. No, no. Look, it's...you were so kind. And it isn't anything to do with you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you ever think that because you own the building, everyone in it, we're all kinda like your children?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know there's a phrase about that in German. Bildenkinder. Used almost exclusively by childless landlords to console themselves. But now? I really understand it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, now you have a bus full of real..bilden..kin..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bildenkinder.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. And they're all dangerously close to not getting pie. And there's only one guy who can save them. It's not me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! [Jim reenters bus through hatch] Hey! How'd it go?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's pretty good actually.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We bonded. We got to- [Dwight starts dropping into the bus on top of Jim]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Whoa! Whoa! Dwight! [group reacts]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When you don't get out of the way! Out of the way!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You feel OK now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, better than OK. [grabs Pam's shoulders] You know what honey? I'm gonna get you that rhubarb pie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, actually, rhubarb is-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't..

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: the one pie that I don't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't..

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everybody! Hang on! [Dwight pulls out quickly]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh! [bus tears around corners as group crashes into each other]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Group chants along] Pie! Pie! Pie!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Pie! Pie! Pie! Pie! [cheers as they arrive]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I changed my mind. [gives Nelly papers]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, you signed it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Not as is, obviously. Made a couple changes. Added some sentences at the end. Trust me it needed it. [laughs] Well, yeah, whatever. So. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [Reading] "She's tough in business, but tender with the people she cares about. She'll make a wonderful mother to any child who can overlook weird accents."

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I insult you, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I insult you! To your face!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Then why don't you do something about it?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [laughs] Kevin, are you trying to get me to hit you? In the face with my pie?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You don't have the guts. You stupid, dumb, doo doo face! [Oscar pies Kevin] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god. I'm getting so stuffed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We did it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You did it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My name is Andy!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: [bored] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't do drugs!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Now check the style!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of Flatt & Scruggs!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Yeah. [Andy plays banjo]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Role call.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Role call.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Role call.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What?
